item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 1, 2025 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Happy New Year 2025 (635 points | 159 comments)
2. I got promoted to staff engineer twice (32 points | 25 comments)
3. Static search trees: faster than binary search (320 points | 98 comments)
4. An Unreasonable Amount of Time (90 points | 6 comments)
5. Arnis: Generate cities in Minecraft from OpenStreetMap (310 points | 51 comments)
6. Large Concept Models: Language modeling in a sentence representation space (65 points | 13 comments)
7. Nvidia bets on robotics to drive future growth (65 points | 42 comments)
8. The GTA III port for the Dreamcast has been released (334 points | 96 comments)
9. Déjà vu: Ghostly CVEs in my terminal title (104 points | 26 comments)
10. I Reversed a Drone and Landed It with My PC (97 points | 20 comments)
11. The psychonaut field manual [pdf] (41 points | 11 comments)
12. Things we learned about LLMs in 2024 (646 points | 444 comments)
13. FBI: Largest homemade explosives cache in agency history found in Virginia (86 points | 83 comments)
14. Lucy: A concise language for describing Finite State Machines (30 points | 2 comments)
15. Ask HN: Does the Framework laptop stand the test of time? (69 points | 36 comments)
16. Celestial Phenomena in 16th-Century Germany (9 points | 1 comment)
17. After a 24-second test of its engines, the New Glenn rocket is ready to fly (44 points | 55 comments)
18. Building Game Prototypes with LÖVE (128 points | 47 comments)
19. Cesium for Unreal – Bring the Real World to Unreal Engine (17 points | discuss)
20. Deepseek: The quiet giant leading China’s AI race (374 points | 322 comments)
21. Bench.co acquired after informing staff company was insolvent (50 points | 26 comments)
22. Penrose Mazes (2020) (79 points | 10 comments)
23. Revisiting the NetBSD Build System (102 points | 13 comments)
24. Debugging memory corruption: who the hell writes "2" into my stack? (2016) (336 points | 146 comments)
25. 3D-printed neighborhood nears completion in Texas (31 points | 44 comments)
26. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (383 points | 314 comments)
27. Just Words (YC W24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
28. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (625 points | 209 comments)
29. Systems ideas that sound good but almost never work (322 points | 197 comments)
30. Morris Chang and the Origins of TSMC (203 points | 54 comments)
